creator: nes@students.uwf.edu
text:
There's been many times when I've needed to schedule a script to run at certain
intervals, ex every hour or once a day.  But only have FTP access to the web
server, so no access to standard cron utilities.  Could apache be modified to
hit certain pages on a given interval, configurable through .htaccess files?  Or
is this something I should take-up with the PHP folks?

Thanks.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
No, nothing like that is planned and probably won't ever.

Typically people use one of the free cron services which trigger http requests then.
